data.title: Very helpful staff
data.text: Good place , close to T station. Very helpful staff. Good sitting area just outside in the plaza area.

data.title: Very good staff
data.text: The staff here are extremely helpful and have amazed me on more than one occasion. They listen and even go out of the way to make sure you are happy.Thank you.

data.title: standard DD menu in lobby of office building
data.text: There's a small dunkin donuts with their standard menu in the lobby of this large office building across the street from the T and city hall.  I most often stop at this DD after an appointment in the Harvard Vanguard doctor's offices upstairs.  There is lots of cafe-style seating in the lobby area, and currently no other restaurant on the other side of the seating to compete.  Parking here is often difficult (or expensive if you use the garage without dr's office validation) so this spot is best for those without cars.

data.title: Hot coffee Pleassseee!
data.text: All the Dunkin Donuts trying to give me ice coffee all the time--often don't get my order right--seem like they don't know me even though I go everyday and order the same hot coffee 98% of the time.  I would love to see  some HoneyDews in my area.  The donuts and muffins are so much better there.  Also check out the donuts at  Donut and Donuts at Scamell st.

data.title: Best D&D service
data.text: Always fresh, never stale... Smiling staff & clean building! Perfect! This is the Dunks I visit most often in the Quincy area.

data.title: First Dunkin Donut site
data.text: Well we were so excited about this stop but soon realized that it really wasnt worth our time. The outside sign was neat but once we stepped inside our excitement quickly passed. The employees forget that they are working at a historical location and dont appear to appreciate that fact. They clearly dont realize that some of us travel hundreds of miles to visit this location and are quite excited to be there. The workers rushed us to make our donut selection all while we were looking around trying to enjoy the moment....there was no line so the rush was not necessary. My husbands favorite Dunkin Donut is the Chocolate Long John which of course he eagerly requested. The lady very rudely said "what do you want?" Of course he once again requested his favorite long johns and she looked at him like he was a three headed sea creature and responded with a very nasty "I dont know what you are asking me". Clearly she has had someone from the Midwest visit and ask for this type of donut. No effort was made to talk to us, invite us to their historic store, thank us for coming or trying to even make conversation about what a CHOCOLATE LONG JOHN was! Well anyway, we did buy an assortment of 6 donuts and they were fresh and good as always. Good donuts= Nasty, rude, uninviting, and four very abrasive Dunkin Donut employees. Not really worth a stop inside. Take pictures from outside and go buy your donuts from one of the other 200 Dunkin Donuts that you will see on your trip in and around Boston!!!!

data.title: Java at the original "Double D"
data.text: There's something historical about ordering a cup of coffee the the original Dunkin Donust shop. Located on Southern Artery in Quincy, Ma. the shop has just been renovated to lool like it did back in the 'ole days. Double D coffee is the best and so are all their sandwiches. My favorite is the tuna melt on a croissant

data.title: First Dunkin Donuts
data.text: Food is as usual with Dunkin Donuts.  What is special is that this is to go to the one that is that first Dunkin' Donuts build.  One area looks like it did in the 50's.

data.title: Sea Street Dunkin's the worst service
data.text: With so many coffee shops in Quincy, you would think the customer service would be top priority but for some reason the Sea Street Dunkin Donuts employees act like they are doing you a favor. If you don't tip them, expect a dirty look. When you do tip them, don't expect a thank you. McDonald employees do not receive tips but find a way the say thank you every time!
